name: Nicole
text:
I can't say enough good things about my experience here. I had taken my wedding dress to be altered at another location, got it back from that tailor 4 weeks before the wedding date, and it was too long, the bustle had been done incorrectly, and the dress was crooked. (It had been taken in about 2.5 inches on one side, and an inch and a quarter on the other side.) I was devastated and stressed, and a friend recommended Mr. Hem.

Not only did Steve correct the initial alterations, he also treated me with the utmost respect. He treated my dress with such care and such an incredible attention to detail. Once the initial mistakes were corrected, he also touched up other aspects of the dress that I hadn't even noticed were flawed myself.

What got me the most-- he said to me, "my job in this is not so much the tailoring, my job is to make this as stress free for you as possible.'

I love my dress, I love the service I received and the speed in which it was completed. (And I don't know if he took pity on me, but he charged me a fraction of what I had paid at the first tailor I visited.) I would trust him with all of my future alterations, and I would recommend him so highly!

name: Amanda Brodka
text: Mr. Hem did a phenomenal job on my Sail to Sable and Lilly Pulitzer dresses. He was straight forward on what needed to be done (hem let out, sides taken in, zipper moved, etc) and I appreciate his help on deciding what would be best. He finished sooner than he anticipated (bonus!) and the dresses look pristine (as if they came straight from the rack looking perfect as the day I bought them). I will definitely use Mr. Hem if I need any other alterations done, best work ever!

name: Dónall Ó Domhnaill
text: BEWARE!!  These are the most cavalier, arrogant and incompetent individuals in the alterations business.  I brought two brand new suit pants in for what I thought was a rather simple and routine alteration - until I encountered Mr. Hem.  The first pair of pants were marginally acceptable.  The second were RUINED!  Both pairs of pants had uneven and carelessly sewn cuffs.  The ruined pair had stitches layered upon stitches and looked like a middle school science project gone very wrong.  They admitted to cutting off too much material.  One of the employees stated "I don't know why he did it.  It does look horrible."  Their "fix" was to sew a strip of bulky black fabric over their butcher's work.  After the too short barely one inch cuff, the first thing anyone will see is the black band of fabric around the inside of the cuff on my gray pant legs.  Owner refused to call me to address my concerns.  Worst customer service I have ever experienced.  GO ANYWHERE BUT MR. HEM!!

name: Susan Crain
text: Been going here for years excellent service and alterations are impeccable

name: Kyle Donaghey
text: Completely unprofessional. I dropped off 3 pairs of pair on Friday, was told they would be ready the following Friday. I called on early Thursday to see if they had been finished early, was told they had not been started. I was told I could pay the rush charge to have them done, told him that was fine. He told me he would call me later in the day when they were ready. Never received a call. I called to try to check on the status around 4:30, phone went straight to a voicemail that was full. I then drove to the office, and he told me that he had just found my pants at and they would not be ready today. I cannot comment on the work, because I took the pants and am taking them elsewhere

name: Hannah McCrory
text: Will not be going here again. He told me it’d be 300 to alter my formal dress and that I should just get another dress. Went somewhere else and they said they’d do it for  70 and that it was an easy alteration...I was also told that my dress choice "didn't look good on my body type" which was also upsetting.

name: Jeff Ystueta
text: I have been looking online for a local place that does alterations. After doing some research, and getting a recommendation from a friend, I figured I'd stop by Mr. Hem to talk about getting my overall's altered. I walk in and start to tell the man (who I assume is Mr. Hem) that I need the pant legs to be slimmer on my overalls. Without warning he stops me and says he can't do it because "you could buy two pairs of overalls for what it costs" and at that point the conversation was pretty much over. Little did he know I was more than willing to spend a good amount of money to get my pair of $200 overalls altered. And I seriously doubt any alteration costs $400 to slim the pant legs down. I felt disrespected and as if I were being judged as not having money the second I walked in the door. Unfortunately I will have to tell my friend that their recommendation was not willing to even talk to me for more than 30 seconds.

name: dd p
text: super helpful with my dad's snow suit. it was bought at a big box store for big and tall and he's short and stout :)  so they altered the legs. Poor guys I'm sure had down feathers everywhere.

text: Best in town by a long shot !

name: Carlos Mitchell
text: They know how to get you right and fast

name: Dave Enderton
text: Mr Hem has done several suits for me now and always provides top notch service. Furthermore, I always have a positive experience in terms of customer service. He has rushed several items for me for last minute events and has very fair prices.

name: Kristina Ledford
text: My husband asked me to pick up his hemmed pants that said they would be ready today.  I spent my lunch break going to Mr. Hem navigating through all of the construction in Auburn right now.  He asked me if he had called to let me know the pants were ready.  He hadn't- also I was just trying to do a favor.  So I wasted my break trying to get the pants that said they would be ready today- not in fact getting the pants.  After he was rude with me I just told my husband he can get them himself, I will not be going back to Mr. Hem.

name: Edwin Oliphant
text: Great service!

name: marybeth humphrey
text: very rude

name: Emma Claire Davis
text: Incredibly rude

name: Brittany White
text: Had my suit jacket tailored and my suit pants hemmed for my wedding! she did an EXCELLENT job! Will definitely go back for any future alterations.

name: Ell K
text: This is the absolute worst place to take any items!! My girlfriend took a brides maid dress there and she received it back with a huge stain on the back!!  They refuse to take responsibility for there actions!! DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME OR PRECIOUS ITEMS with this company!! This is for A1 -

name: Ronald Smith
text: Very professional really care about what they do they're real personal make sure that what you're looking for great experience

name: Brian McDowall
text: I have had several times repaired, expanded, contracted. The owner, Joy, has always been pleasant and done great work.

name: Nick Westbrook
text: I had some jeans with a significant tear in an unfortunate place. I brought them here, and within 20 minutes, my jeans were mended, and at an affordable price too! Thank you A Alterations!

name: Jeff Brosius
text: Pleasent service... Would recommend

name: Demetrice Walker
text: I goes here all the time they do excellent work on what ever you bring to them.

name: Lin Whittington
text: A Alrerations is great! Ms Joy and staff have always done a great job for me and are very reasonably priced. I'm reluctant to do this review because I don't want them to get so busy that I can't get in!

name: Armand Chevalier
text: I do not recommend A’s Alterations. Miss Chamnong aka Miss Joy is greedy and overcharges you for men's clothing. The prices are not consistent, and they use cheap thread that unravels and they overcharge for corrections on their error. Then they try to charge you for the repairs again when you point that out. The more clothing that you bring to them the more that they charge you. Miss Chamnong said that she charges customers according to the type of vehicle that they drive. So if you have a nice vehicle she charges you more than other customers. And they hire illegal undocumented workers. They take a very long time to finish items and prioritize other customers who arrive after you. They have very long waiting times to get measured cause there is only one changing room. They also smoke and will steal your money if you do not remember the original cost for a repair. I do not advise anyone giving them business. I would give A’s Alterations a zero rating if possible. Miss Joy Chamnong aka A’s gets an F minus and flunks for being so crooked, and dishonest with how they overcharged me for something that I payed less for the first time even with the receipts to confirm the cost.

name: krissie womble
text: Always great service!

name: Kim Dennis
text: Always very friendly & attentive --- very conscientious about their work.

name: Denise Courtney
text: Love these ladies

name: beth com
text: I know people complain about her being rude but I've never had a problem with her. She's curt and straight to the point. There's no small talk with her. She does a great job for a reasonable price and is extremely fast! I've used her for bridesmaids dresses, hems of pants, skorts for school, and even weird alterations that she had to piece together different materials. She always does a good job and it's ready when she promises it. I can't complain! Just don't expect a super friendly talkative person

name: Madeline RR
text: I am devastated.  She has ruined a bridesmaid dress for my sister's wedding.  I don't know how she can be licensed to alter clothing.  The dress is too short on one side and too long on another.  It's a $300 dress that is completely ruined and there is no way to fix it. I could have overlooked the rudeness if she did a good job.  Please, if you have clothes you want to wear again never use this business. She should be put out of business.

name: ManU Soccer
text: Owner/seamstress is EXTREMELY RUDE!  No personality at all.  Would highly recommend going elsewhere...anywhere but here.  We needed alterations made to homecoming dress and after she has my daughter put on the dress she says she can't do anything with it.  Would it have been that difficult to look at it first instead of rudely dismissing us after she changed into it????  Hypocrisy at its worst!  Christian posters all over the place but not an ounce of Christianity in her!  Brisk, offensive and dismissive demeanor all the way around.  save your time and money and avoid this place!

name: Jennifer Reinhardt
text:
Not rude to me even once!& I was there a total of 4 times. She hemmed 3 bridesmaids gowns for me in 2 days only 35.00$ each.
Does great  work in a timely matter & an awesome price!!

name: Alice Grayson
text: I love Miss Sylvia she doesn't excellent amazing job in her price is very fair

name: Susan Johnson
text: Alterations Next Door is accepting appointments for former customers of this, now, closed location.  I'd love to be your neighborhood tailor.  SJ

name: Becca Goodwin
text: Very rude customer service on the phone. I could not get the questions I needed answered out, because she claimed she needed to accept another call and told me to just "bring them in" before she hung up on me. Chose immediately not to use this service.

name: Rachel Doyle
text: Absolutely HORRIBLE! Called to see how much it would be to trim the bottom of my dress. She said "$25" I went in and she was absolutely rude to me and up the price to "$35" Which, was fine. I told her I would be back Saturday to pick it up for the ball that night. I arrive Saturday morning at 12:00p.m sharp and the store is closed. The sign on the door for closing says 1:00p.m and her Facebook says 2:00p.m. I go next door to the Asian grocery and luckily the owner has the number to her granddaughter. They tell me there is no way that I will get my dress that day and I am out of luck. I start hysterically crying because I have paid over $400 total and I have no dress for the night. After hours of sitting in the parking lot crying my eyes out I finally get in contact with her and she says she will be there. Once she gets there she tells me very rudely  "I leave early on Saturdays because I have stuff to do" I replied with "your Facebook hours says 2:00p.m and the sign on the door says 1:00p.m" I could not believe what I had just went through with this lady and the fact that she was still rude to me! AND she trimmed my dress too short!!! I will NEVER return and I hope everyone else takes this review with major caution! I truly believe you must be prompt with your hours! ESPECIALLY in a business like this!

name: Vickie Cook
text: She just about ruined by dress. Worst hem I have ever seen!  She tried to tell me it was right, but I sew and it was horrible!  I will have to redo it myself. I took it to her because I didn't have time. I overlooked her rudeness because she did a good job before. STEER CLEAR OF SYLVIA's.

name: Donzetta Crum
text: Only if she had touched the helm of Jesus garment...oh my what would Jesus do! If ANYONE knows any good, repitable, reliable, qualified seamstress, please post it on this site, because apparently she isn't qualified to hold a needle to thread due to the ppl she's hurt, tormented, and terrified with her lack of compassion for her fellow man. Everyone whose had bad service should report her to the nearest news channel/BBB or someone who can assist because that's really cheating ppl out of their hard earned money. Start posting qualified and compassionate seamstress's info to assist others who may need it... maybe that will open her eyes to see the error of her ways... hopefully. This is just terrible customer service, and I pray GOD who sits up high and looks down low touches her heart to change & turn from her wicked ways.

name: Caitlin M
text: I went to get a cheerleading skirt altered here and the owner was very rude. The next day when I picked it up it had 2 holes in it and the stiching was terrible and obviously not correct. The owner did not even tell me about the mistakes, I noticed it when I took the skirt out of the bag and then demanded a refund. I was crying so hard because the uniform was $400 and i had to wear it the day after I picked it up because we were taking team pictures and I have to wear the same uniform for the next 2 years. I had to go to another alterations store to get it fixed and the owner there said she has people come in asking her to fix things from Sylvia's frequently. I would give this place 0 stars if possible. Please save yourself the stress and heartbreak and do not use this store.

name: monica parry
text: She is beyond rude and unwilling to please customers. Her customer service is TERRIBLE. She treated me like she didn't want my business which is really weird. I mean why is she in business if she doesn't want customers? Save your gas and money and go elsewhere where they treat you better.

name: Bobby Thompson
text: While she does fairly decent work for a price much higher than expected, this woman is down right mean. While she blared her right wing radio she made sneer comments about the clothes I brought in for tailoring as well as sneered at me the entire time. I won't be going back there.

name: Sarah-Lambert Bender
text: Very quick both doing the work and in helping me figure out what I needed done. Did an excellent job altering the bodice on a new dress for me.

name: Windy Hocutt
text:
Terrible.
Everyone is right on point. Christian stuff everywhere. Fox news on tv.
Extremely nasty attitude. Acted like she was eyerate about something actually. Against my better judgement i left a $400 dress w her bc a friend suggested her. When it arrived to me it looked like she had thrown it on the hanger. It was hanging on by one side of the halter dress top. Seam was busted on the hip. The hemline was terrible. Too long everywhere except the right side, and the first layer was hanging out in the back on one side.
The woman is nuts!

name: Mark Mullen
text: Terrible customer service indeed, and she is downright rude. However, she is reasonably priced and has a good turn-around time.

name: Brandon Coke
text: syvia is very rude and inside has a foul odor

name: Thomas Beck
text: Price was not right.

name: Riquel Turner
text:
Great Services! He added sleeve's to my prom dress and he cut a few inches off at the bottom! Etc
He makes sure everything is perfect and is to your liking!!❤️

name: Theopolis Jackson
text: I recommend to go to this guy. He has done an excellent job on fixing my work bag. Didn't think it could be salvaged,  but he got it looking brand new! I'm definitely going back to him if I need anything to be tailored.

name: Crystal Hutcherson
text: They were so gracious to do what ended up being some major alterations on my daughter's pageant dress with a very short amount of time!!!! I had been to and called 6 or more other alteration shops in my area and none would take it with such short notice so I am EXTREMELY THANKFUL!!

name: Becky Grohman
text: Lloyd was the best person I could have met to help me win a crown. He redesigned a dress to my desires. I was thrilled with his work. I will use him again for another pageant.

name: Ann Bosarge
text: I just picked up a dress today that was altered - it was waaaaay too big. He did a great job! I am very happy with my “better fitting dress!” I would recommend this place to anyone who wants a professional alteration!

name: Kay Addy
text: Nice work! Better than others I've used. I'll definitely recommend!!

name: Michael Thompson
text: Top of the line work. He repaired a zipper, replaced the liner, and made some alterations to my old leather jacket. The work was flawless and you can not see that any alterations were done. The stitching blended perfectly. I will absolutely use him again and recommend him to anyone needing this type of work.

name: Dani H
text: There is no better tailor in Mobile, AL. He is very accommodating, kind, and goes above and beyond to make sure you're happy. He has altered many dresses for me and never disappoints. I even entrusted him with altering my wedding gown for my destination wedding in Jamaica. He addressed all of my concerns and made my dress everything I wanted it to be. He is also my husband's tailor as well. We have yet to present him with something that he couldn't fix. I will go to no one else.

name: Josh Cooper
text: Lloyd is amazing. He helped us out with a cosplay costume we ordered from China. The sizing was off; but he fixed it, and it looks better than it did when we received it in the mail. My son could not be happier.

name: juju pell
text: Excellent work and great Customer  service. Lloyd takes pride in his work and he delivers  perfection.  # 1for sure

name: Aeja P
text: I was in a bind and needed my homecoming dress altered and dry cleaned two days before the dance and after we dry cleaned it the next morning we took it to Lloyd’s and he did an amazing job .He is very polite and worked with us to the best of his ability and we really appreciated it

name: leah dearmon
text: I am a repeat customer of Lloyd's and extremely pleased with all the work he's done for me. Will highly recommend him to anyone.

name: William Davis
text: Outstanding gentleman & outstanding professional services!

name: Telford Holmes
text: Great place to have Alterations on Ball Gowns.

name: linda garner
text: Very experienced, quick, and friendly

name: Alexandra Hill
text: I got a bridesmaid dress altered here for a wedding in June that was 1-2 sizes to big and was way too long. I picked it up (earlier than expected) and it fit me PERFECTLY. Like it was MADE for me. It was stunning. She did a FANTASTIC job and in such a timely manner!

name: Audrey Crowe
text: Mary is amazing!! I brought in a free people dress that I wanted to wear for my graduation that was a couple sizes too big. I had already taken it to another alterations shop in town who said they would not be able to help me with it. The dress is formal and has several layers, and it was no problem for Mary!! It fits perfectly and she had it finished a month before I needed it. Highly recommend, especially for the more formal stuff that other places aren’t able to do!

name: John Hutzler
text: Awesome service! Good prices, will definitely return! They made repairs on three of my garments and you can't even see where they did the work! Verry happy customer!

name: Jennifer McKibben
text: Really great work! My husband lost weight and they were able to alter his pants and vests to fit him perfectly. We did not have to wait long for the finished results. We will definitely use their services again.

name: Kimberly Storey
text: I can’t say enough good things about Mary! I gladly drive 2 hours for her to take care of my equestrian competition garments that require a very specific fit. Alterations are impeccable every time! She essentially had to completely rework and rebuild garments after my weight loss and look incredible. I highly recommend her work!

name: Kyle Donaghey
text: Mary did an excellent job tapering a few older pairs of jeans, they fit better and feel like new pants.  To my knowledge, she is the only person that can do this in Auburn.  Very happy and will certainly use her again!

name: Daniella Bassi
text: Can't get service without a mask, and they do not provide the masks. Just be aware.

name: Sami Ansley
text: I had my wedding dress, which was several layers of fabric including a very delicate overlay, originally altered in Montgomery at some high priced ridiculous place. They told me they could not alter it to be tighter in the waist because of the design on the back. I took it to Mary's Alterations and amazingly(!) she was able to fix my wedding dress to fit me perfectly. I have found her prices to be reasonable and when more expensive it is due to the type of work/fabric. You truly get the quality you want when you go here. I recommend it all the time after trying other places in Auburn and other cities. It is the best.

name: Liz Logan
text: Excellent service and the ladies are super sweet! I needed an emergency alteration for a bridesmaid's dress and she was the only would who would even take a look at my dress... She altered it the same day and I picked it up before 5 and it still was very reasonably priced and looked amazing! I was so thankful she was able to help me out! Would recommend to anyone!!

name: Jodi Hallum
text: I was just in my sisters wedding in Wisconsin. I had to have my dress shipped here and altered. I am so pleased that I went to Mary!! I only had a few days and Mary seen me right away,was very sweet,very professional,and did an amazing job!! Thank you so much!!

name: Rachel Powell
text: I went to have a bridesmaid dress hemmed and it was $67!! I can understand the outrageous pricing if more work was required on the dress, but it was only shortened slightly. The work seems adequate but I would highly recommend looking for a different alteration shop if pricing matters to you.

name: Jamie Shultz
text: I have been going to Mary's Alterations since she opened her shop. She always does great alterations and the quality is amazing! I won't ever go anywhere else, I trust her to do the best job with my garments and highly recommend to friends and family!

name: Bob Broach
text: Quick service, reasonable prices

name: John Saidla
text: She is a wonderfully delightful lady to take care of all clothing alterations and repairs. We have been using her for years and never disappointed.

name: Tamika Renée
text: Super fast fix of my coat button! Also they fixed the zipper on my favorite pants that I've kept for more than 12yrs!  Woot woot!

name: James Shultz
text: Awesome service, she is the best in town for in quality and prices. I'll definitely recommend her to everyone!

name: Amy Bromberg
text: We went in this morning needing 2 suits for a funeral. The store was busy, phones were ringing, yet we received the most fantastic, personable customer service. Both pants required hemming, which was to be completed by Monday. We called about an hour later to let them know services were Sunday, and the pants were already hemmed! The staff offered their condolences, and were truly a joy to interact with. The sale was awesome, and they let us know how to get the most for our money. We will go back to this store every time the need arises. Thank you for everything.

name: Deserel Clark
text: My experience was top notch. I will definitely be going back.....

name: Collins
text: Solid service - quick turnaround time - loved the suit

name: Jennifer Baxter Howard
text: Went in to see about getting a wedding suit for my husband to be, but after waiting around for 15 mins, no one approached us to help or acknowledge we were waiting to be seen. Went to belk instead.

name: Colby Lane
text: Great store for men who need suits, business, and business casual clothing.

name: Michael Garrett
text: Great store for men who need suits, businesss, and business casual clothing. Suits are tailored to fit and they have a great selection of ties, cuff links, etc. Shoe selection is nice but not huge. Products are well made. One bit of advice-work the sales. Their regular prices are a bit high but there is almost always a sale going on.

name: Kelly Turner
text: Had the best experience getting my custom suit because of the amazing staff at the brookwood location. Ronald made our family feel like we were home. He took all the stress out of acquiring our wedding attire. Thank you so much Ronald .. every jos a bank in the nation needs you!!!

name: Greg Pennington
text: Hey Joseph A Bank, why don't you just sell each individual piece of clothing at a reasonable price instead of clustering multiple items when you pay a lot of money for one item. So confusing just simmer down a bit. I thought that you would like a review with some down to earth language!

name: Andrew Hamiter
text:
I purchased a shirt from this location and came back to exchange the shirt for a larger size without a receipt.  First, I was told that they do not return items that have been worn.  Moments later, the "manager" told me that they would buy it back for 50%.  I asked the "manager", "is it not true that you send shirts to the dry cleaners after they have been tried on?"  He replied, "yes".  I asked, "but, you can't take this shirt back and have it dry cleaned with the rest of them?"  He shook his head.  I asked for the manager and he said, "I am the manager".

they took my information and put it in the system when I purchased the shirt, so there is a record of my purchase.

The last experience that i will ever have with the store left a sour taste.  The sales staff, mainly the "manager", left me highly disappointed in their professionalism, honesty, and concern to make it right.  I drove to another location and they exchanged my item for a larger size without too much hassle.

My advice:  Go to another brand name store for quality service.  My friend, who is a former Jos A.
Bank employee, recommended that I take my future business to Brooks Brothers at the Summit.  I forward that advice to all of you.

name: Robert Levy
text: Great men's clothes and employees. "Regular price" is rediculously high. Only buy with good sale

name: Kasey Lange
text: I had the absolute worst experience at the Brookwood Village Jos A. Bank. I used them for my groom and groomsman suits for my June wedding. Every time one of the men would go to get sized or pick up something, I was called and asked questions that were answered by simply looking at their computers. I felt like I was constantly just telling them how to do their job. Also, some of the suits still did not fit properly even after getting fitted. I would not recommend them to anyone!!

name: Jonathan Coffey
text: Quick service. Eric did a great job.

name: Keith Casborn
text: Always pleasant and helpful.  My Favorite for sure.

name: David Morgan
text: I spend far too much money here. The associates are fairly knowledgeable and are more than adequate. Don't expect expert advice but the product is solid.

name: Houston Piatt
text: Cj was very friendly and helpful, I will definitely be going back

name: Emily Ness
text:
I wish I had read the reviews before I went. I had a terrible experience there while purchasing a gift for a friend. The staff at best was indifferent to my presence. When I checked out the salesman wouldn't even look at me or make eye contact. It seems ridiculous to be so upset, but part of the reason I went to Jos. A. Bank was because I wanted knowledgable advice.

I do think the tie and socks I bought are nice, but next time I'll go somewhere else.

name: David Barr
text: Good quality clothing at reasonable prices.

name: Carson Landers
text:
I normally don't do reviews, but I've had so many bad experience with three Jos. A. Banks stores that I'm going to go on an adventure. Here I go.

Part 1:
This particular store was the worst of all. My wife (now) and I walked in, walked up to an employee that was just standing there drinking a soda not doing anything, and told him that we were getting married - that we needed to buy 12 suits for their buy 1 get 3 free sale. That's right. 12 suits. He looks at us with a blank stare and just points off in the distance and says that we can look over there for some.

Later on, we get someone that actually knows how to communicate. He doesn't know how to fuit someone for a suit even though he tries but does horribly, but then he keeps running off to the first guy we walked up to to tell him sorry for taking his customer. We were never his customer to begin with.

My wife and I were completely stressed out after this. I could go on about other details, but in the end we walked out. We were going to buy 12 suits, but they couldn't care less. I haven't had this poor of service in a long time even though buying a suit is where customer service is supposed to be very important.

Meet me again in Part 2 at the Huntsville, AL Bridge Street store.

name: Y Liu
text:
Manager Paul has poor customer skills and called police on me to ask me leave. Paul is very unreasonable and has his sole management discretion about me (Asian and new to America).
Police told me not to come in this store ever again just because manager Paul wanted so for no reasons. It really hurts a new customer's feelings.

name: Marc Schaefer
text: Quality clothing with great service and reasonable pricing.

name: Ross U
text: Decent selection of men's suits with a generally friendly staff.

name: Davis Dudchock
text: Great service - special thanks for Chris Lewis for the help

name: Russ Luepnitz
text: Amazing mens clothier.  Always look for the sales.

name: Rafal Ablamowicz
text: Excellent service.

name: William Waters
text: Great place very helpful

name: Jeff Cornett
text: Great service

name: Brian Curtis
text: Staff friendly and helpful

name: Ken Goetsch
text: Great choices and selections

name: Bryan Chatman
text: No one greeted me.  I wandered and left.  The store had more employees than customers.

resp.text:
Bryan,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. Rest assured this will be addressed with the regional and store management team of our Birmingham, AL location for review and training purposes. We’d love to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you’d like to discuss this with us in greater detail, please email your preferred contact info and the best time to reach you to at JABListens@josabank.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
JAB Listens

name: DADDY BAMA MUD FLAPS
text: Great place to shop

name: Arlen Mininger
text: Bought a suit there.

name: Michael Bolam
text: Thanks ,Good Job on my suit!

name: Michael Fain
text: I got the run around. They were late on getting my alterations complete and when I did get them, they were not correct. Then it felt like they kept trying to fit me in clothes that didn't fit. Will never buy clothes from them again.

name: matt henry
text: Brought in a pair of Tuxedo pants I bought at another JA Banks store.  Missed the tailor date, horrible customer service.  Go to another store.  Terrible....

name: Jeffrey Thompson
text: Awesome. Cheaper then alterations shop on post. Way better hours she also did a top and hat for me in 2 mins for the same price. Which is way cheaper than on post. Only down side is she has no credit card machine. Cash only so go prepared.

name: Breawna Davis
text: Very reasonable prices and amazingly fast! I dropped off 3 OCP blouses to get the rank replaced and agreed to pick up 3 days later. The next day I stopped in to also get a PC sewn and she was already done! She did the PC right then and there to save me a trip. Great experience, thanks!

name: kylie hyde
text: Did not have a good experience. I paid extra to have the mesh layer of my dress down instead of just cut and it isn't sewn, just cut and not very well at that. Also asked for it to be floor length and specified I needed it to touch the floor and it is a good 3 inches off the ground.

name: Brian C.
text:
Good and honest small business, I ran in last second to get my rank sewn on and she did it on the spot inexpensively.

Minus 1 star for the lack of card machine in 2019.

name: JHB 2010 (JHB2010)
text: Very fast sew on. Had my uniforms back within 10 minutes. The lady is kind of rude, but that's water under the bridge.

name: Cody Cooper
text: Not open during posted business hours. What's the point of having hours if you cant commit to them?

name: Jeff Snodgrass
text: Would highly recommend! Great quality work! God Bless!

name: PrettyPrincessQiana
text: Quick.  Effective.  Efficient.  Right on time.

name: Patrick Ingraham
text: She can fix any garment

name: Swaroop Vitta
text: Best tailors. Albert and Raj are both so professional and affable guys. Their tailoring is pristine as well.

name: Hewy NoSleep
text: Very lucky to have bespoke tailoring in Birmingham. I have used other places but they only modified a templates but Kripalani was the first place that actually made a hand sewn individual suit. When you walk in you can see how many famous individual use his services from the photos and thank you letters on the wall.

resp.text:
Dear Sir.
Thank you very much for your kind words.
Sincerely
Kripalani’s

name: Sydney Ott
text: The customer service here is incredible. Everyone is very kind and helpful. I brought a mink coat in for repair of ripped shoulder seams and had it back in mint condition within a week. They did an excellent job. Highly recommend.

resp.text: Dear Miss Ott, we are pleased to know that we satisfied you in fixing your mink coat. We hope for your future patronage.

name: nirio collins
text: Best tailors in Birmingham! I highly recommend. Extremely friendly and professional. I’m most definitely going back.

resp.text:
Dear Mr Collins.
We had a pleasure working with you, and look forward to your future opportunities working with you.

name: Ethan Summers
text: What a treat! Ram altered a jacket I inherited from my wife's grandfather and my favorite peacoat. He was a lot of fun to talk with and learn from while we worked. Even walked us out to the car with an umbrella to keep us out of the rain. The alterations were exactly what I wanted. I highly recommend this shop.

resp.text: Dear Mr Summers, we really are appreciative of your patronage and are pleased to hear that you and Mrs Summers were satisfied it’s your fit. We look forward to your future patronage.

name: Maddie Abbott
text: Absolutely love this place! Family owned, extremely hospitable staff. They pay attention to every detail and do exceptional work. If you are looking to get high quality alterations from an incredible tailor, this is the place! I will definitely be using them for years to come.

resp.text:
Dear Miss Abbott.
We are pleased to note on your utmost satisfaction during your visit to our business. Miss Abbott our  business goal is to treat and serve our clients like our family member with courtesy and respect. We appreciate your patronage and look forward to serve you and all our family of clients with Courtesy and respect. Have a safe 4th July, and once again thank you for your business.
With kind regards.
Kripalani’s
Hong Kong Tailors. inc

name: Christopher (Chris) Simmons
text: Superb service. Some of the best service I’ve had. Good prices too.

name: Lito Delmo
text: Best tailors in the Southeastern USA. Keep up the great work, Ram and Bob!!

resp.text:
Mr  Delmo.
We appreciate your comments and look forward to seeing you again.0

name: Emily LaRussa
text: We took my fiancé’s suit in to be altered for our wedding. We were told the suit did not look good on him. Shortly after we were told our choice in suit was poor. Do not recommend. Very disrespectful and rude.

name: Ben
text: Excellent service, quality work, and good people.

name: Chas Mason
text: My many years of experience with Ram and the rest of Hong Kong Tailors has been nothing short of exemplary!  I recently engaged Hong Kong Tailors to make my tuxedo for my wedding.  Not only did Ram and his staff make sure every detail of my tuxedo was perfect, they also made custom clothing for my father and grandfather.  Everything they produced was a perfect fit!  You will not find better customer service and attention to detail in the clothing industry.  I have recommended them to all my friends, and I will continue to recommend them to anyone who asks.

resp.text: Dear Mr Mason thank you for your kind words and your patronage all these years. We look forward to our long lasting relationship with you and your family.

name: Jim Hubbard
text: Ram provided me with 2 tailor made suit 20 years ago that fit perfectly and looked great. The quality of fabrics and the customer service is something that does not come by everyday. Once you deal with Ram one time, you will never look elsewhere. That is why he has been the leader in the business for over 20 years!

resp.text: Jim, we appreciate your kind words. Thank you for sharing your sentiment.

name: Grantham Patterson
text: I'm a new customer to Hong Kong Tailors and I have to say they, by far, exceeded my expectations! Ramesh is an extremely knowledgeable and personable tailor. He and the other staff go out of their way to make you feel welcomed in their store and comfortable and confident in your clothes. I brought in a suit that I had recently purchased elsewhere to have some minor altercations done, but after my experience with them I regret not purchasing a suit from them from the start. The quality, price, and speed of their service is excellent. I love supporting good people with good businesses, so I will definitely be giving Ramesh another visit in the near future.

resp.text:
Dear Mr Patterson.
We are sorry in thanking you for your patronage, as this was our oversight. We look forward to your long lasting patronage.

name: David Hedges
text: Outstanding products, extremely high quality, top notch service. I have purchased all my dress shirts from them since my arrival in Bham over nine years ago. Great alterations also, brought three pairs of pants in on Saturday morning and Ram said I could pick up on Tuesday!! Treat you like family.

name: Abby Chaplin
text: I needed a formal dress hemmed and I thought i was just going to walk in, they would mark where to sew, and then i would leave. I was very wrong. As soon as i walked in, a man greeted me at the door and offered me water or soda, asked what i needed, and thoroughly examined the dress and how he could hem it to the best of his ability. As he was reviewing the dress we got to know each other and he was extremely personable! They are by FAR the best tailor, seamstress, and alteration place i have ever been to! I highly recommend going to Hong Kong Tailors!!!

name: Peter Neuberger
text:
Outstanding customer service and quality with prompt turn around of work completed, usually within days. Individual and personal attention from people who care (like Ram and family) with reasonable, affordable pricing. No one does it better than HKT.

Peter Neuberger

name: Adam Coe
text: This place is truly fist class!  Each time I have been here the owner has been very personable and took a lot of time to alter my suits.  The quality to their custom suits are fantastic.

name: Personal Best
text: Let me put it this way: I drove from the top of Wisconsin to Birmingham, AL JUST to buy from Ramesh. I simply won't go anywhere else. And if that doesn't convince you, then consider going in and looking at the list of his clients. I will never buy Bespoke anywhere else. Ever.

name: Stephen (Trent) Wright
text: A+ service. I would recommend Hong Kong Tailors to anyone. Ram, is extremely helpful and he will help you achieve the proper fit.

name: Pratricia Dewan
text: Best tailors in this area. They give you reasonable prices and have wonderful customer service.

name: abdulrahman aldriweesh
text: I have tried to do my jeans and they asked me to go to try it on but I had a sample with me so they said no need and we will just check the sample and they wasted 10 minutes then they said I should take somewhere and did not give me a reason why except it is difficult where they should have told be from the beginning so I can leave!!

resp.text: Sir, it is regretful that you had an unpleasant experience. We try very hard to please our patrons. Sometimes even our decades of experience leaves us incapable of reaching the expectations of individual . To quote Connie Mack, “ you can’t win em’ all”.   Please take care and stay well.

name: J Chris Mason
text: Best custom tailor in Birmingham

resp.text:
Dear Mr Mason.
We appreciate your patronage and your satisfaction.we look forward to your future visit.

name: E R
text: Best tailors around!  Highly, highly recommended.

resp.text: Thank you so much we appreciate your business and will share your feedback with our team.

name: Scott Stone
text: They guys are great. Very helpful, great service.  Ram really opened my eyes to what a good suit should be. They were also able to alter and really improve my existing suits.  I will definitely be going back for my next suit.

name: Matthew Whitaker
text: The guys are awesome.  Over the top customer service.  I've been going here for years and tell everyone I can to do the same.

name: chris tobe
text: Ram is maticulious and my dozen shirts came out wonderfully.  A top notch business!   I will be a repeat customer.

name: Phillis Anderson
text: Friendly people. Great place for clothes and alterations.

name: Randy Toffel
text: Today was my first visit to Hong Kong Tailors. I've spent a very frustrating couple of weeks trying to put together some formal wear for a black tie wedding event in Dallas. I'm a BIG guy. My body's built funny....super long torso.....short legs...6'3" tall 29.5" inseam...I finally had a dinner jacket overnighted to me that needed some sleeve alterations. I had another jacket that I needed to have altered because of the weight I've lost. Mr. Kirpalani took care of everything and is going to have it ready for me a couple of days before I leave for Dallas. He told me that if I'd come to him last week he could have just custom made my jacket for me. Never again will I go to Men's Wearhouse, DXL or any of the other big and tall places for a suit or jacket. If you're a Big and Tall man, I absolutely recommend that you pay this fine establishment a visit. They epitomize what customer service should be. Thank you so very much Mr. Kirpalani!

name: Luke Martin
text: I had a pair of slacks taken in at the waist and in the thighs. Cost more than I expected but based on what the tailor said I thought he knew what he was talking about and would do a great job. The first time I put on the altered pants, they came apart one of the seams because they were too tight. Tailor let out the thighs slightly and repaired the tear "for free." However, they tore again getting in to my car about two weeks later. Same process, and same result. Tailor was way to aggressive with the alterations, and apparently the sewing process is not the greatest since the seam kept coming apart in the same location. I have basically worn these pants three times after getting them last Christmas. I will not go back.

name: Geisha Chan
text: Love the owners, really good people, great sense of humor! Do a fantastic job with alterations.

name: John Farrington
text: Very happy with alterations, excellent work great service! Slightly pricey, but 100% worth it!

name: Kenny Krackenberger
text: Great business and even better people!

name: Caleb Bagwell
text: Great customer service. Very thankful for their willingness to help.

name: Michael Jones
text: I find it difficult to express in words how much I love this business. Ram (Rah-hm-esh) and his family are friendly, detailed, meticulous (as another reviewer noted) and IMO THE BEST IN BIRMINGHAM. The suits I have had made are works of art as much as they are stylish and functional. The pockets are real. The stitching is perfect, and material options are plentiful. I am convinced you cannot buy a better suit in Birmingham and get any more value for your dollar. I am so thankful there is a business in Birmingham where I can go to get WHAT I WANT in a suit (high quality, impeccable fit, unique style, and friendly tailoring). I get compliments on my suits EVERYWHERE I wear them. The walls of the shop are adorned with handwritten gratitude of EVERY household name in Alabama, from Barkeley & Spann, to Tuberville and  Saban. I think I recall even seeing Governor Bentley's thank you letter. (Don't hold me to that one). I have so much confidence in Ram's sense of style, I leave some of the details completely up to him and often don't even know what color or pattern I'm getting until I arrive to pick it up (I kind of like the excitement and mystery of the surprise & I am confident he would make it right if I didn't like it). He has never disappointed me. When I met Ram, he told me something that has always stuck with me: "The value of an ounce of gold has been the same since it was first used as currency. It has always been worth a shave, a fine suit, and a new pair of shoes." It's simple, but I find a lot of truth in that.

name: Gregory Duncan
text: Fantastic service

resp.text:
Dear Mr Duncan.
We appreciate your patronage an d are glad to note about your satisfaction. We look forward to your future patronage.

name: Patrick Marshall
text: Unbelievably expense and a RIP OFF!  $150 just to get my suit altered for my wedding.  Then, after I got it back, the hem came undone before I even tried on the pants.  I would suggest anywhere but here, unless money is no option.  This is 4 times the costs of any of my previous alterations.

name: Christopher Daniel
text: Rahm makes the best suits in town.

name: William Neighborsjr
text: the place to get fine cloths in alabama

name: Hal Scoggins
text: Love shopping at his bank they have a friendly and helpful staff

name: Charles Flowers
text: It was a great place to visit.  I took my grandson for measure mental and purchases.  The sales person was great and helpful.  We will visit again in the near future.

name: Daniel White
text: Great staff. Always helpful and take the time so you get what you need.

name: Nick Howard
text: Great place and people work there! Very nice and affordable mens dress and casual clothes.

name: David Jason Bruno
text: Fantastic staff and great clothes for the price. Very well worth the trip if you don't own a suit.

name: Daniel Porter
text: Nice place nice people

name: Tim M
text: The store manager was very helpful and knowledgeable about his store.

name: Jerry McDow
text: Was looking for a specific shirt of a specific color . They didn't have it but we're very helpful in trying to help me find one .

name: Robby Flick
text: Way overpriced for the area.

name: d k
text: Nice store, product, and staff, and sales.

name: Will Hall
text: Robert is nothing short of a legend. Since I first walked in his shop it had felt like I’d known him for years. He has done one of my suits and my tuxedo and I won’t take them to anyone else. Very fair prices and exceptional work.

name: Christiaan Mauldin
text: I've had several alterations done by Robert Hill's. Always quality work, fast turn around, and friendly conversation. Prices seem fair when compared to others/Google searches.

name: Christopher D Prevel
text: Mr. Hill is the consummate professional tailor. If Birmingham, AL had a Bond Street, London, his would be the premier shop!

name: Niki Pham
text: I gave Mr. Hill the fanciest pants I own, and he did a beautiful job with them. I really needed them fixedly as quickly as possible, and he was very accommodating. I’ll continue to work with this friendly and professional business!

name: Madison Griggs
text: Lovely staff, great service! I had an appointment to get a bridesmaid dress altered somewhere else—but when I showed up, they couldn't take me. They sent me to Robert Hill and I'm so glad they did! They're very helpful, fast, and reasonably priced.

name: Michal Crowder
text: He was very kind and went above and beyond to make sure I was satisfied!

name: Creed Robbins
text: Mr. Hill was incredibly friendly. Did great work at a good price, and was able to get it done super quickly. I highly recommend him for any tailoring needs.

name: Lionel King
text: Great service

name: Matthew Hinshaw
text: I’ve had a lot of tailoring done here and all of it has been excellent. Mr. Hill is an outstanding man and always meets his deadlines. Highly recommend.

name: Danielle LaBombarde
text: If I could give 10 stars I would!

name: dean robinson
text: Best tailor in Birmingham

name: Matthew McCarley
text: Flawless work

name: Hiten Patel
text: Best in city

name: Jacob Bowers
text: Ask for Lance when you go! He helped me pick out my entire wardrobe for my new job. He made sure everything matched and made the process so easy. I'll never shop anywhere else. Lance gained a client for life! Also really affordable, especially for the quality.

name: Jeff Dorough
text: Great store. Great suits

name: Mike Estevez
text: Patrick is a rock star! His customer service skills are rare in today’s culture. I genuinely felt like he cared. Men’s warehouse has gained a customer for life just because of the way this man treated me.

name: Joe Sanford
text: The guys there did a great job. I felt very attended to. They were extremely knowledgeable about your selection. I give a them a 5 star rating.

name: Mary Derr
text: Good experience. Very helpful & knowledgeable about their merchandise. Had to buy a suit, shirt, tie & shoes for my husband for our son's wedding.  A young woman named Kennedy helped us & she was great! Thought prices were reasonable.

name: Donna Bailey
text: Incompetent is one way to describe them. Went in and ordered my son a 40R Chamois jacket. In 3 days, we received a 42R Brown jacket. Wrong size AND color!! I call and I'm told they'll replace it with the right jacket. I have called 3 times for an update.  First one I'm told it's being shipped from CA. Second time, after being put on hold for over 10 mins I hang up. Call back and a manager, which put me on hold the previous time forever, tells me they can't replace it and Fedex lost my package. I've waited 3 weeks for them to get the right jacket and now I need one next week for my son's senior prom. Do Not shop at this place!!!!

name: Nicholas Davis
text: Staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. I would definitely recommend using them.

name: Ashley Murff
text: Staff is very knowledgeable, versatile selection, affordable. The tape measure around the salesman's neck, I think his name was Adam, the pen in his mouth, his journal, the fit presentations and smiles are a nice touch. :) Great buys, 10 minute hem, no lies!

name: FeC ENG
text:
Overall, we had a good experience at the store, but it was a little odd.

We started out strong meeting a representative, Kate. Who greeted us, was quick, proactive, we liked her. But this other guy cut in and pushed her out. We (myself and the family) liked her. She was respectful, addressed us as soon as we walked in the door, gave us her name, and seemed really easy to work with. The other guy just felt like a salesmen.

We ALL wish we could have kept working with her. I, girlfriend to the stud getting the suits, wish the other guy did not push her out. I wanted her opinion. A young, fashionable, professional woman brings a lot to the table when it comes to attire. I would have respected her input. I hope the company allows her to work closely with clients in the future.

Please note that I have rented suits for myself from Men's Wearhouse so I am also a customer (being a woman in engineering, my friends end up being guys so I end up on the grooms side).

resp.text:
Thank you for taking the time to share your feedback with us.  We apologize for the service difference you experienced in our Birmingham location between Kate and the other associate.  Your shopping experience should be easy and stress free regardless of who you are working with.  We have forwarded this feedback to the management team for review and training purposes so we can improve.  We look forward to an opportunity to better serve you in the future.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Stephen Ruiz
text: Kate was great and very professional. She made me feel at ease, due to the fact I have to ship my rental to Virginia for a wedding in 3 days. She ensured that I would be walking away with a suit once I got to VA regardless. I'm giving 5 stars now for her great customer service and the overall experience. But we shall see in three days of this service holds true!

name: William Clark
text:
Great staff that knows their stuff! Helped my buddy and us on his big day with suits, and when one of the groomsmen got a suit that didn’t quite fit they rush ordered another and got it in right on time.

I’d definitely recommend this place for setting up suit rentals or just for asking opinions on a good looking tie.

name: Cliff Lumpkin
text: Needed a suit in 2 hours...David got me one in less than 30 minutes. Altered, hemmed and steamed all done in less than 30. Thank you!

name: Richard Arrington
text: They staff at Men's Wearhouse, has great service,

name: Roi
text: Always great service. Needed a quick alteration for a funeral the next morning, they worked me in and took care of it. I have Never had a bad experience there.

name: Mark Whitlock Jr.
text: Marcus Lyles Is the most important asset to your store in my opinion. He helped me with my wedding attire and now has helped with 2 custom sport coats. As long as he is on your team I know you will succeed!

name: Gregg
text: My daughter was getting married and I had to rent a tuxedo. I was expecting to be there for a while but the employees couldn't have been more friendly and knowledgeable. The tux was also unbelievably comfortable. If you need shirts, ties, socks etc. they sell these as well. If have recommended to numerous friends and will continue to do so.

name: Stephanie Williams-Velazquez
text: I went to pick a tuxedo for my nephew. I was picking it up because on the previous day when my nephew went to get it, it apparently had been sent to the wrong store. I get there and someone had picked it up from the correct store and neglected to call and inform him. I get to the place where suit was suppose to be and it is too big and no sizes to fit even though he was fitted weeks ago. It is a few hours until the wedding and this child has to wear this if his mom can't find a suit to match.

resp.text:
Hi Stephanie, we are sorry to learn that there were so many issues with your nephew's order. This is certainly not the kind of service that we aim to offer. We would love to help.
Please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Eric Campbell
text: Very attentive, professional and knowledgeable staff. All of my expectations were exceeded. Will shop there again.

name: smjaygal
text: NOT AL ALL CHEAP. That said, this place offers high quality clothing of the suit variety from shoes to shirts. We went here to get my husband fitted for wedding clothes and yes they do that for free and won't throw you out for looking like you can't afford a pocket square. I would absolutely recommend this chain for suit lovers who can afford to drop well over 700 on a full suit.

name: Izz Noland
text:
I have been 5 times already for registering and fitting for my wedding which is now only 5 days from today. My measurements were wrong the first time, so I went back and saw the manager. She measured again and changed everything. When I received my suit for the final fitting, everything was as per the original measurements and too big. They are supposed to overnight my new suit which I'll see 3 days before my wedding.
In addition, my son is very small, and I asked for the smallest fit. He received a regular slim fit instead of extreme slim fit which looks baggy. I was told by the person on duty that they don't have extreme slim fit for children (my son is 11, so I'm paying full price for his rental). I don't believe this to be true and will be speaking with the manager soon. I will not recommend them to anyone else. All of my groomsmen and father of the bride are using them, and the father of the bride at a different Men's Warehouse didn't receive his shoes. I can't believe we're paying $200 / person for all of the hiccups during the preparation phase.

EDIT / UPDATE - My new arrival came in a couple of days before my wedding and fit fine.  In the shuffle, the new order had a white shirt instead of ivory and I didn't realize until the day of my wedding that my shirt was ALL wrong!  Luckily Newnan in GA was able to fix me up.  My mom drove over an hour both ways to get me an ivory shirt.
Meanwhile, I'm waiting on my custom suit.  They were supposed to make up for ALL of this with a "special" custom suit, and there's nothing different about the one I am receiving versus any other Joe Custom Suit.  (mind you there were 7-8 in the bridal party who all rented suits from Men's Warehouses across the Southeast who all had some sort of issue).
I went in yesterday to pick up after my final fitting a week ago, and they had not touched it.  I was told on a Tuesday I could come get it on the weekend.  No calls, no emails, nothing.  So I go in AFTER the weekend and it had not been touched and they said, "wait 10 minutes and we'll have it ready."  NO!  I don't want my custom suit rushed.  I should add that customer service reply 4 months ago gave me a nice discount on my rental, and Kyla and David mean well at this location, but they can't, and shouldn't walk behind all of their employees.
This is the worst experience I've ever had with any establishment in the US. PERIOD. FULL STOP.

resp.text:
We appreciate you taking the time to share this feedback with us. We sincerely apologize for all the errors faced in getting the rental garments ready for such a special occasion. We have passed your feedback along to the upper management team for review and training purposes. We’d love the opportunity to connect with you and make up for this negative experience. If you'd like to discuss your visit with us in greater detail, please email us your wedding group details and best contact number or email at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so a member of our team can follow up with you.
Best Regards,
MW Listens

name: Andrea Bedor
text: Tyler assisted my husband and I with purchasing a suit for our anniversary. He was extremely helpful and loads of fun while we were shopping. He made sure that we were prepared for our special event. They were able to accommodate our very short timeline and they did same day alterations.Thanks Tyler!

name: Agent Phrosty
text: Easiest time I've ever had buying a suit. Zachary was very knowledgeable and understood our needs. He more than exceeded our expectations and helped find me two sharp suits with matching shoes for a price that didn't break my budget.

name: Joel West
text: I had a great visit the other day. The prices are not the cheapest but to some extent, you get what you pay for. I had a store assistant named Marcus Lyles. He greeted me as soon as I walked in the door. He spent alot of time with me making sure I got everything I needed, that it fit correctly, and looked good. His expertise is priceless and I will shop there again because of him. Great job  Marcus!

name: Samantha Hall
text: My husband is 6'2" and 270lbs. His clothes from Men's Wearhouse always fit great.

name: Guy Able
text: Excellent customer service. I visited for a suit fitting and rental for a wedding party and had a great experience. Knowledgable and courteous staff. In and out in less than 20 minutes. Will return in the future.

name: Thomas Weeks
text: Really great service. Met me at the door and was very personable. Great knowledge and knew exactly how to help me. Without a doubt, will come back.

name: John
text: I had a pleasant experience when it came to this location. Everyone was friendly and worked quickly to get our order done.

name: Lynn Rickard
text: Very helpful and friendly, quick to serve and got us in and out in no time!

name: Shealynn Seaman
text: Ask for Caroline Stephen's! She helped us find the perfect suit for a special mother son outing. Can't say enough about her attention to detail and excellent level of customer service! We will be back!!

name: Christopher Godlewski
text: STAY AWAY!!  This place takes customer service and respect to a new low.  Purchased a jacket to wear IN MY OWN WEDDING, was promised to have it in 2 days . . . delayed going out of town just to get the jacket and it wasn't ready.  Had a bunch of items ordered for possible purchase; was told they'd be in on Wednesday and to just come on in.  Thought better of it and called, no sign of them.  Called back on Friday, the items had been there for days.  The Assistant Manager tells me "sorry, I work with a bunch of idiots".  He then tries to sell me a jacket that's not even close to fitting in the shoulders and tells me "I can just get it altered".  Anyone who knows anything about jackets knows if the shoulders don't fit, the jacket doesn't fit.  Tried to order even more items to exchange for a jacket I'd gotten, can't even get the AM to call me back after he again blamed the "part-timers" that work for him.  DON'T EVEN WASTE YOUR TIME HERE.  They should either close this branch or fire everyone and start over.

My event is Friday and if it’s not in before then  my prom will be ruined! DO NOT EVER GET ANYTHING HERE!! And the staff is extremely incompetent and are Poorly trained !

We were in and out in 20 min.  The reviews are certainly not representative of the level of professionalism at this store. Great work.

text: I was impressed. First time to a Bham Men's Warehouse and was reluctant to visit this location based on previous reviews. New management has done a great job working to right the ship. John was an attentive and patient salesman.

text: The staff here were very friendly and attentive. They were able to help us find what we were looking for in a timely manner.

name: Anthony Colón
text:
I am not having the best service to say the least. The buying process was great,  however, we are now almost a month out from my promised date for my custom made suit. Originally, I needed it for my graduation and was able to wear another suit for that event. They said customs take longer than the original date I was promised, May 9th. They said it would arrive on May 20th instead and I would receive a phone call. No call on that date, I called on the 23rd and it was there. They refitted my pants which is great, and the jacket fits perfect, but said it would arrive today, June 4th. It has not arrived yet.

I think the frustrating part is not that I don't have it, but that it is not ready by the promised date they said it would arrive. Perhaps, better communication would be helpful too. I have another event this weekend I would need it by and hope it arrives before the end of this week.

I feel this is a costly mistake on my end and will be wiser in any future purchases.

(Edit: wrote to email from Men's Warehouse a few days ago and haven't received a response.

Today, June 12th, I called the store and my suit was ready for pick-up. Again, why was I never contacted as they initially said they would reach out to me and let me know when it arrived?

Ideally, I would like to hear a response from Men's Warehouse and hopefully give them input so they can improve with their customer service.)

resp.text:
Anthony,
Thank you for bringing this to our attention. This is certainly not the level of service we strive to provide our customers with and we sincerely apologize for the inconvenience. We would love to reach out to the store and have your concern addressed. If you'd like to discuss your experience with us in greater detail, please email us at MWListens@menswearhouse.com so we can follow up.

I call to inquire about it and the "manager" says yea it's here....you can come pick it back up whenever you get a chance I don't really have another alternative for you. Talk about PISSED!!! text: Of the three tuxes that were fitted at this location, all three were returned as they were several sizes too small. name: Jessica
text: Absolute worst service ever! My husband went in to get fitted for/pay for a suit for a friends wedding and we had to make 2 trips back to the store that day due to errors on the staff's part. Then my husband went to pick up the suit he has PAID for already and they told him it isnt in yet which it should have been because it had already been a month. One phone call to corporate the suit is magically found so my husband makes yet another trip to the store. Then once he picks the suit up the belt and dress shirt are missing which our receipt clearly states that he has already paid for. We purchased this suit in February and we are still dealing with them to get everything we paid for!! Will never go back once we get everything we have paid for!!!!

name: Doug Hartman
text: I am hard to fit and John took care of me and had me looking good in my new dress shirts for work.

name: Justin Marden
text: Very polite and helpful staff, they assisted me with my tux rental for a wedding. When I picked up my tux, I was in and out in under 20 minutes.

name: Shana Flury
text: Rented a tux and it was completely the wrong size. Had it sent back to be fixed and they promised it would be ready the day of the wedding. It was not, they have no record of the reorder and have nothing to replace it with. While on the phone with them they put me on hold 9 times, and each time a new employee answered the phone where I had to explain the situation again and again. Employees acted like they had never handled a suit fitting before. Will never use men's wearhouse again.

name: Kelsey Chapman
text:
Do NOT go to this store. We had a pretty bad experience with them. I went with my fiance and two brothers to buy them suits for the wedding, and weren't treated very well. My middle brother wears camouflage, jeans and boots all the time and obviously the employees there aren't used to seeing that and deem anyone who does wear it beneath them because there was a very rude comment made about my brother behind his back but within earshot. After our 2 hour trip there, he had to use the restroom, on his way to the restroom he passes by an employee helping a mother and her son. The employee proceeds the comment after seeing my brother "what is that?" And laughs with the mother and son he's currently helping. Strike one. You can tell the man helping us deems it beneath him also because he acted like it pained him to be seen with us and halfway measured them for tailoring until we told him more needed to be done to make the suits look like they should. Strike 2. They tell us at checkout that the suits will be ready in two weeks on a specific date and we could come pick them up. My fiance and I make a special trip again to come pick them up, get there and they have to search for our order and lo and behold....it's not ready. But "don't worry. It will be ready tomorrow. You can just get it then." No we can't because we have to drive for 2 hours and can't just keep doing that on a whim. Not a call, email or anything informing us that the suits weren't ready. I firmly believe they had just stuffed them into the back room and forgotten about them. Strike 3. We have yet to go back to pick up the order because we haven't found the time but I'm waiting for the next mishap. So if you were to ask me, NO do not go to this location. Terrible service. Rude and think they're better.

Let me add: After going the 2nd time to pick the suits up. We had to wait almost 20 minutes for them to locate and 'steam' our suits when we had already called on the way to let them know we were coming to pick them up. Get home with my fiance and he tries everything on, the suit fit good but the shirt was the wrong size and they gave one of my brothers the completely wrong colored vest.

name: Hayden Rankin
text: When I tell you what an experience!! I mean WOW what an amazing experience I had at this location!! Joseph Damico needs to be payed more money!! They need to give this guy a raise! Wonderful customer service from Mr. Damico! I came in the store with expectations of getting a couple ties, and BOOM!! Before I knew it he upsold me and I ended up walking out of there with almost 3000$ of merchandise! Great salesman! I wanted to hire him myself! He as very enthusiastic and says he is ABBOUD! Haha great guy! I told my wife I wanted to pay him to be around me all day!! Lol if you are needing any clothes go to Men's Wearhouse on 280 and ask for Joseph Damico!

name: Christie Estes
text:
To echo what the previous posters have said; it is very unfortunate that you cannot give 0 stars. Better yet, I would assign a negative number if that were an option. If you do not read any further, the takeaway is this: Run don't walk to Jos. A. Bank for tuxedo rentals. I have never encountered such incompetence or ignorance as I have at Men's Wearhouse.

Where shall I begin. . . If you go to Men's Wearhouse you will be lectured ad nauseum about the importance of everyone in your wedding party providing the group number at the fitting. Great in theory. In reality, we were given the incorrect group number. Thankfully, one of the groomsmen caught the error and provided us the correct number. Yes, let that sink in. No one at Men's Wearhouse was competent enough to provide the number. Don't stress the importance of something and then screw it up. We were, of course, offered no explanation as to why we were given the incorrect number.

Moving on to the next issue. I had a coupon from a bridal magazine that I provided during our initial visit. This coupon was to be applied to each tuxedo rental (14 total). Do you think it was applied? Of course not. It came to our attention when several groomsmen commented on the cost of the tuxedo rentals. Of course, there was no explanation for why the coupon was not applied.

At this point, it is Thursday morning and we are getting married on Saturday. Have they called to tell my fiancee that his tuxedo is ready? Of course not.

And, here's the best part of the story, every time I have called to point out some screw up, the phone is answered "Hi. This is _____. How can I provide you with world class service today?" Well, start with doing your job and being competent. But that isn't going to happen. Go to Jos. A. Bank and save yourself the headaches.

name: Melinda Henkel
text: After all of the guys had gone and gotten fitted and paid in full for their tuxes, we ended up having a HORRIBLE experience. Only one of the tuxes fitted right upon pickup. One of the guys had pants that were shorts and 10 sizes too big with a vest that was 5 sizes too big, they wouldn't do ANYTHING to fix it because try to give new pants that didn't match. The junior groomsmen's jacket was too small. One of the shirts had sleeves that were 3/4 type sleeves instead of full length meaning he couldn't remove his jacket. It was horrible and I am still not done, we deserve to have our money back.

name: Michael Koratich (BioGuy)
text: Service is exceptional price even at BOGO is a bit steep.

name: amy deloach
text:
There are far too many things wrong with this store. Where do I begin?

I'd give zero stars for this particular location, but 1. you can't give 0 stars on Google Reviews, and 2. we did actually have a good experience renting our wedding tuxes with one of the managers Homer (who is the only competent employee here, so I give a star to Homer. And well, we didn't actually pick up the wedding tuxes at this location, just placed the order, but I'm pretty sure if we did get them from here something would've gone wrong.) but everything else we have tried to do at this store was a complete fail.

My husband ordered a couple suits and two pairs of pants to get alterations done. They completely wonked up the alterations and made the suit look like a baggy potato sack. We actually did extensive research on how men's suits should fit and the finished product didn't turn out to look anything like the books.

Not only were the alterations terrible but they weren't completed on time. Something about the pants not being shipped on time, but they were smart on their part and gave us a phone call to tell us it wasn't ready when they said it would be.

After the messed up all the alterations my husband went back for a second fitting to have them fix the problem. The first suit was completed in a timely manner and turned out exactly how he wanted it to be. They told him to come back the next Saturday and the other suit and two pairs of pants would be done by then.

This is where things get screwy. The second suit's alterations were completely off, and it seemed like no one had touched them. Pair of pants #1 were even longer and baggier than the pants on the suit, like they definitely were not touched or tailored whatsoever. They were too long by a good 4-5 inches and too baggy in the waist. ON TOP OF ALL THIS PAIR OF PANTS #2 WAS NOT DONE AND NO ONE HAD CALLED OR INFORMED US THEY WERE NOT READY. They said the tailor had left for the day. SO WE HAD DRIVEN AN HOUR TO GO TO THIS STORE TO PICK UP NOTHING BECAUSE ALL THE ALTERATIONS WERE WRONG AND THE ORDER WASN'T EVEN COMPLETED.

It is very very very clear that some managers in here are not doing their jobs correctly. I came here on a Saturday night - the store was a mess. There were ties and handkerchiefs not hung up, hangers not spaced evenly apart, the phone was ringing of the hook and no one was picking it up, and all the employees were either watching TV and I believe the manager was outside on his cell phone. It is clear that the tailors, or at least one of them doesn't have a brain and is completely incompetent. I understand that these people are most likely overworked or underpaid but it is such a disappointment to receive poor customer service in our economy because there are plenty of people who are more intelligent and harder working that can't find jobs because schmucks like the people at Men's Wearhouse are getting paid to watch TV, talk on their cell phones, and leave work before getting their jobs done.

This store is a joke and it is pathetic. We will never ever be back again.

name: Alex Green
text: They measured me and had my suit tailored and ready in only a week with good buys and good deals.

text: If you're in the market for some really nice men's clothing this is the place for you! There's always a deal going on too.

The sales staff give the impression that they are helpful but once you walk out the door they do not follow through on their word. I was told this store got an entirely new staff based on poor performance in the past... it's time to get new management again. I will never go back and I warn all of you to do the same.

name: Adam Foutz
text:
I hate leaving bad reviews, but this store deserves it. I needed a new suit for a wedding, and went in to order my suit well in advance. A pair of pants had to be ordered, no big deal. After 3 weeks of not hearing anything from them, I called and was told "we'll call you back." No call back. So, I called again a few days later and spoke to the store manager. I was then told "I'll call you back before lunch." Guess what? No call back. I was up against a deadline, and gave them well over a month to get a PAIR OF PANTS in and get an entire suit tailored.

After calling numerous times, I physically went up to the store and got my money refunded. The manger was there and knew who I was, and offered to get it tailored same day. Too late, I ended up having to rent a suit for my event. I highly suggest going elsewhere to find a suit in Montgomery, this store is incompetent. Spend the extra money elsewhere.

name: Sarah Stack
text: I dropped my wedding gown off to Christine a month before my wedding. She planned to "let out 3 inches" of the waistline. I called her shop to check the status of my gown the day I was told it would be finished and she implied to me that she hadn't even started altering it yet. She asked for 3 more days (making it 10 days before my wedding day). 3 days later I went to try on my dress and I could not even remotely zip up the entire top half of my dress ( which was not the case when dropped it off to her..I could not comfortably zip it up and maybe had 1" that I couldn't zip). I believe she took it in 3" instead of letting it out. After informing me there was no fabric left to let it back out, she then proceeded to embarrass me in front of other people in her shop. She asked if I could find better undergarments to "suck all of that in". When I replied that apart from removing a rib or two this is as good as it gets for me, she said "honey...there is more than just ribs going on here." She said "I can't think of anything to fix this. If I do, I will call you in the next two days." I did everything I could to leave as fast as possible so I could get in my car and cry. Thank goodness for Dillard's having formals and I found a decent replacement the next day (9 days before my wedding). Regardless of her skills as a seamstress on other projects, I will not recommend or return to Christine.

text: I had done business here before so I went there in July for a September wedding it's August 22 just got suit back first time it was supposed to be ready she had not started it so we waited again when we went to pick it up the plate on left side of pants was folded over and sewn to the part that covers zipper. Instead of addressing the error she wanted to argue with me very rude in front of other customers that came in and my kids trying to make me look like I was the problem only to admit she did so it when my husband took the pants off and i began examining the alterations and threads hanging that she didn't trim off which matched exactly the threads used to sew the plate to the zipper cover even after admitting this wanted to insist I was rude I'm lije no ma'am I kept trying to ask you about this and told you it wasn't like that before she tried to say someone else must have done that I said no ma'am it's never been altered before coming here. The alteration was mainly to take in the seat and well needless to say it wasn't done right she still charged me full price and he can't wear this suit without further alterations. I'll never go back there she's ugly person has no idea about alterations on a suit.

name: Alabama Coast
text: Christine is a lifesaver. Embarrassed by having to bring my "consignment store" gown in at the last minute, she smiled and said "I will take care of you!". What a blessing!!

resp.text: Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your feedback. We value your business.

name: Melissa F
text:
I needed a bridesmaid dress taken out a little and hemmed, when I arrived she rudely told me to put the dress on so she can see what we have to work with, when I came out of the dressing room she was grabbing at the sides of the dress and acting like it was the most stressful task she had ever encountered. She kept saying "oh, I can't do ANYTHING with this" and "Can you lose any weight before the wedding?" By the time I left her establishment, I was in tears... As I was leaving she looked at me with pitty and told me she "will pray for me".  No thank you, I don't need your "prayers", I need my dress fixed.
Two good things did come from this awful experience- First- I did find an amazing friend that was able to corset the back of my dress and make me feel wonderful in it. And second... I learned how to sew so I could fix my own clothes without ridicule.
I do NOT recommend this woman... Not after the way she made me feel about gaining a few pounds.

name: matsi hound
text: This woman's carelessness resulted in ruining the only wedding that I will ever have. She is extremely unorganized. She took my wedding dress home to work on (says she doesn't work on formals in her shop) and then put it in her unlocked car overnight and it WAS STOLEN TWO DAYS BEFORE MY WEDDING!!!! Or so she says. I think she just messed up on it or procrastinated and didn't do her job so she just made a phony report and cashed in on her business insurance. Either way, no I will never be back and if you do business with her, I pray that she does not shatter your dreams like she did mine.
